intro: Erigeron biolettii, commonly known as the desert blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky habitats. Its leaves are generally narrow and grayish-green, adapted to reduce water loss in harsh conditions. The flowers bloom in early spring, producing a delicate blue or purple hue that attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies.
